content: The Hidden Rate Elimination Act of 2001, also known as the Reduction in Marginal Income Tax Rates for Individuals, aims to amend the 1986 Code by eliminating hidden rates and reducing marginal income tax rates for individuals. No amendment made by this Act will be considered a change in tax rates for the purposes of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Reduction in Marginal Income Tax Rates for Individuals, under the Hidden Rate Elimination Act of 2001, aims to amend the tax rates for married individuals filing joint returns and surviving spouses for the year 2002.
